meanings.definition: A substance that kills germs or microorganisms.
meanings.sent1: The hospital used a powerful germicide to clean the operating room.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use a germicide to keep your kitchen countertops free from harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the bottle of germicide, creating a foamy mess.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a germicide, brightening up the room and dispelling any gloom.
meanings.sent5: The germicide sprayed on the doorknobs left a fresh, clean scent behind.

meanings.definition: An agent that destroys disease-causing germs.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a strong germicide to combat the infection.
meanings.sent2: Using a germicide is essential to prevent the spread of illnesses in crowded places.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's secret weapon was a germicide spray that defeated all evil germs.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a germicide, eradicating doubts and fears from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The germicide wiped out the harmful bacteria, leaving the surface sparkling clean.

meanings.definition: A chemical used to disinfect surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The cleaning crew applied a germicide to sanitize the entire bathroom.
meanings.sent2: Always read the instructions before using any type of germicide on household items.
meanings.sent3: The germicide bubbled and fizzed as it worked its magic on the dirty floor.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a germicide, wiping away any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The germicide spray quickly eliminated any traces of mold on the walls.
